intro: Acer pseudoplatanus f. nizetii, commonly known as the Nizetii maple, is a rare and ornamental variant of the common maple. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that display a vibrant green during the growing season and turn brilliant shades of red and orange in autumn. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its unique foliage, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its aesthetic value.
